commit f3e26355d0485238e4c3af50fbf63ecd76d23b23
File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit f3e26355d0485238e4c3af50fbf63ecd76d23b23
commentStart

    Allow onNotSuccessfulTest() to accept Throwable
    
    Remove "Exception" type-hint for onNotSuccessfulTest() and replace with inline checking for proper type based on PHP major version. The calling context for this method was changed in #1748 such that both objects of type Exception and interface Throwable can be passed.
    
    Throwable was introduced in 7.0.0-alpha2, so changing the type-hint to "Throwable" is a BC break; this fix attempts to do the right thing while maintaining BC.


commentEnd
commit 335457d20eac71f95d3fcc2b7b81b8d335526a8b
File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit 335457d20eac71f95d3fcc2b7b81b8d335526a8b

    Merge branch '4.8'

commit 67c9fb1c306c093a27b4ed1cb1356c6d52036932
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit 67c9fb1c306c093a27b4ed1cb1356c6d52036932
commentStart

    Mute chdir failures
    
    chdir() can be disabled in some environments. In which case it will error with an `E_WARNING`.
    
    Processing of the configuration works fine though, so there is no need to error out. If an error happens it should do something on line 131.
    
    Stack for the warning:
    
    ````
    phpunit-unittests:
         [exec] PHP Warning:  chdir() has been disabled for security reasons in phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/Util/XML.php on line 108
         [exec] PHP Stack trace:
         [exec] PHP   1. {main}() /usr/bin/phpunit:0
         [exec] PHP   2. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command::main() /usr/bin/phpunit:535
         [exec] PHP   3. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command->run() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/TextUI/Command.php:105
         [exec] PHP   4. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command->handleArguments() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/TextUI/Command.php:115
         [exec] PHP   5. PHPUnit_Util_Configuration::getInstance() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/TextUI/Command.php:612
         [exec] PHP   6. PHPUnit_Util_Configuration->__construct() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/Util/Configuration.php:196
         [exec] PHP   7. PHPUnit_Util_XML::loadFile() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/Util/Configuration.php:164
         [exec] PHP   8. PHPUnit_Util_XML::load() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/Util/XML.php:71
         [exec] PHP   9. chdir() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/Util/XML.php:108
         [exec] PHP Warning:  chdir() has been disabled for security reasons in phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/Util/XML.php on line 140
         [exec] PHP Stack trace:
         [exec] PHP   1. {main}() /usr/bin/phpunit:0
         [exec] PHP   2. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command::main() /usr/bin/phpunit:535
         [exec] PHP   3. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command->run() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/TextUI/Command.php:105
         [exec] PHP   4. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command->handleArguments() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/TextUI/Command.php:115
         [exec] PHP   5. PHPUnit_Util_Configuration::getInstance() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/TextUI/Command.php:612
         [exec] PHP   6. PHPUnit_Util_Configuration->__construct() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/Util/Configuration.php:196
         [exec] PHP   7. PHPUnit_Util_XML::loadFile() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/Util/Configuration.php:164
         [exec] PHP   8. PHPUnit_Util_XML::load() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/Util/XML.php:71
         [exec] PHP   9. chdir() phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/phpunit/Util/XML.php:140
         [exec] PHPUnit 4.6.4 by Sebastian Bergmann and contributors.
    ````

---------------------------------------------
commit bf5d32320e40e4de892d28a66ce90c7689eb2713
commentStart

    Use the realpath to require the error files as HHVM does not resolve them in phars
    
    This avoids loading the file twice on HHVM because it considers the 2 paths to be different even though they reference the same file when normalized.
    Refs #1684


commentEnd

commit 8431d94e9b1fcf94d72da5aae58897b5fb55b221
File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit 8431d94e9b1fcf94d72da5aae58897b5fb55b221
commentStart

    Allow IsType('resource') to Match Closed Resources
    
    Closes #1451
    
    This uses `get_resource_type` to fetch the "type" of a closed resource
    which is "Unknown". `is_resource` returns false for closed resources.


commentEnd

File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit 7ff96132855db590feb3fc6c9adad59122009ad8
commentStart

    Track php errors as test failures when --filter is used
    
    Unregistering the errorn handler while handling an error was confusing PHP,
    this caused normal erros to be dispalyed in the console instead of tracked
    as test failures when the --filter flag was used.


commentEnd

commit 6f908b194abd4a0f04b01f03b9920602ada687b5
File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit 6f908b194abd4a0f04b01f03b9920602ada687b5
commentStart

    Fixed STDOUT/STDERR IO streams do not exist in process isolation.
    
    The PHP CLI SAPI does not auto-register the standard IO streams when a script is piped into STDIN (which is the case in process isolation); cf.
    
    - https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=43283
    - http://php.net/manual/en/features.commandline.io-streams.php
    - https://gist.github.com/sun/d02c242514c8f34bccdb


commentEnd

commit de80d073253511bcbaca7e9caddba917f724b775
File count: 6
---------------------------------------------
commit de80d073253511bcbaca7e9caddba917f724b775
commentStart

    Exclude system temp directory in stack traces on Windows.
    
    PHPUnit_Util_PHP_Windows writes the process isolation script template into the Windows TEMP directory and loads the script by including the file, which causes an extraneous last stack frame in all test results on Windows.


commentEnd

commit bf93bc2fca12363ae9fe81a94b887b7292136cde
File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit bf93bc2fca12363ae9fe81a94b887b7292136cde
commentStart

    Merge pull request #1285 from claar/patch-1
    
    Support filters when only generating XML coverage

commentEnd
commit 45ba779cfbd0bf2e1ed7a13d159fd6c9a7a437b0
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit 45ba779cfbd0bf2e1ed7a13d159fd6c9a7a437b0
commentStart

    Support filters when only generating XML coverage
    
    Currently filters are ignored if XML coverage is the only coverage being used.
    
    NOTE: This patch also fixes an apparent logic bug; please verify this is a bug before merging. The current code only checks `this->canCollectCodeCoverage` if $arguments['coverageText'] is true, which seemed like a bug to me. If this is intentional, I suggest renaming `canCollectCodeCoverage` to `canCollectTextCodeCoverage`.


commentEnd
commit be5f237df860da88a7cfe247594232cae61845df

commit ccc4279bf2105706a25ae56c8db776e4c5b64030
File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit ccc4279bf2105706a25ae56c8db776e4c5b64030
commentStart
Merge: 461607a d017c32

    Merge pull request #1258 from HappyRay/caseInsensitiveFilter
    
    Support pattern modifiers in the filter command line option.

commentEnd
commit d017c32d113238952de5cf98d54ed1e920bb650d
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit d017c32d113238952de5cf98d54ed1e920bb650d
commentStart

    Support pattern modifiers in the filter command line option.
    
    Example:
    The following will run tests which match the text
    'simple' regardless of cases.
    --filter /simple/i basicUnitTest.php
    
    Added two tests.
    
    Currently phpunit --filter option doesn't support case insensitive filtering by specifying the 'i' pattern modifier.
    
    Case insensitive filtering can be helpful in some situations.
    For example:
    A method is named 'foo'.
    The corresponding test method is named 'testFoo'.
    When we want to filter tests that test the method 'foo', we will need to specify the filter as --filter Foo instead of a more natural filter of the exact method name as --filter foo.
    This limitation makes some automation code to invoke phpunit tests based on the test method selected in an IDE more difficult.
    
    Currently when 'phpunit --filter /foo/i aTest.php' is executed for example, the filter is changed to '/\/foo\/i/' i.e. the code thinks that no regular expression delimiter is given.
    
    This change adds support for case insensitive filtering by properly detecting that a pattern modifier is given.
    
    Example:
    The following
    phpunit --filter /foo/i aTest.php
    will match a test method named 'testFoo'.


commentEnd
commit 54ab7c6d89a691393837e011b849cb9859b2ba2d
File count: 3
---------------------------------------------
commit 54ab7c6d89a691393837e011b849cb9859b2ba2d

commentEnd

commit a8d628ee246265b8dbcd839304c41b8839783581
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit a8d628ee246265b8dbcd839304c41b8839783581
commentStart

    Don't Overwrite Already Existing Environment Vars
    
    Closes #1181
    
    If a variable is already set via `putenv` or if the variable is already
    present in the `$_ENV` array, it will no longer be ovewritten by
    `PHPUnit_Util_Configuration::handlePHPConfiguration`.
    
    This allows users to pass in environment variables fia the command line
    in the usual ways:
    
        bash$ SOME_VAR="a value" ./path/to/phpunit


commentEnd

commit 4a216c74b33f75251ebdf3f6eb6e3bed55e42a15
File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit 4a216c74b33f75251ebdf3f6eb6e3bed55e42a15
commentStart

    fixed compatibility issue with PHP 5.3.3
    
    is_a in PHP 5.3.3 does not support third parameter (allow_string) thus $object parameter cannot be string.


commentEnd
commit 45a5574c03f3c72fcd0cf4bd8fbe9cd766207bf2
File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit 45a5574c03f3c72fcd0cf4bd8fbe9cd766207bf2
commentStart

    Fix: serialization of test suits static properties
    
    When --backupStaticAttributes switch is set static properties of classes derived from PHPUnit_Framework_Test are also backed up due to wrong use of instanceof.
    
    <string> instanceof <object>|<class>|<string> is always false. One should use is_a(<stringClassName>, <stringClassName>, true).
    
    This bug affect all versions of PHPUnit that uses PHPUnit_Util_GlobalState class.


commentEnd

commit 3352d4fc3cf2c24f7e103cceb14938af7e3d5f40
File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit 3352d4fc3cf2c24f7e103cceb14938af7e3d5f40
commentStart

    Refactor getLinesToBeCovered to use simpler code from getLinesToBeUsed.
    
    These two methods were very similar, but took two very different
    approaches to how they were constructed.  The getLinesToBeUsed seemed
    nicer to work with (fewer regex's specific to this function), so I
    picked it as it the better of the two.
    
    I'm not aware of any differences in behavior introduced by this change,
    although the "TemplateMethods" bit referred to is something I am not
    familiar with.
    
    The main goal of this refactoring is to make it possible to increase
    functionality of both @covers and @uses without doing so in incompatible
    ways.  The common functionality should be able to be extracted out into
    a shared method to help with this.


commentEnd
commit fd8b1fedf119d34775547b759a65d475870810d6
File count: 1

commit fd8b1fedf119d34775547b759a65d475870810d6
commentStart

    Rename loop variable to match getLinesToBeUsed.
    
    Trying to reduce the difference between these two methods.


commentEnd

commit 4adb118251a140202f62efbd57ed31a38b653571
File count: 7
---------------------------------------------
commit 4adb118251a140202f62efbd57ed31a38b653571
commentStart

    When one test creates a mock object, sets staticExpectation and throws an unexpected exception afterwards, the state of the mock object class, which is saved in a static member variable, is not cleaned up before invoking the next test. This can cause the next test which sets another staticExpectation on the same class to fail.
    
    See https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/1143 for more details and an example test that demonstrates this issue.
    
    The fix is to clean up the mock objects' state after each test is run or an exception is caught.


commentEnd
commit e9ff339a660a7bbbd4e725abefb156ec6453d4b4

commit e9ff339a660a7bbbd4e725abefb156ec6453d4b4

commit 36cc20f7f7efa52947a48cd0d11de1742a28231e
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit 36cc20f7f7efa52947a48cd0d11de1742a28231e
commentStart

    Fixed a bug in PHPUnit_Framework_Constraint_Count
    For instances of Iterator, it called [iterator_count](php.net/manual/en/function.iterator-count.php),
    which (unfortunately) changes the instance's key. This fix `rewind`s the iterator's key to where it was


commentEnd

    	PHPUnit/Framework/TestSuite.php


commentEnd

File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit 89b9c5d695d127d1cc338e76a87eda9dbac94486
commentStart

    Improved support for asserting on traversable objects.
    
     * Assertions using `PHPUnit_Framework_Constraint_Count` now support traversable objects.
     * Assertions using `PHPUnit_Framework_Constraint_TraversableContains` now give messages that mention the `Traversable` interface.


commentEnd

commentStart

    Fixes #573, Fixes #552, Fixes #582.
    
    [BC BREAK]
    
    All relative paths in a configuration file are now resolved relative to that
    configuration file. When upgrading, you may need to update relative paths for
    the following configurations:
    
     * `testSuiteLoaderFile`
     * `printerFile`
     * `testsuites/file`
     * `testsuites/exclude`


commentEnd

commit 8c3ef881740a426cf66026f13d83c0ffc57b82dd
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit 8c3ef881740a426cf66026f13d83c0ffc57b82dd
commentStart

    Added $options array to TestCase::getMockFromWsdl
    
    Summary:
    
    So that the SOAPClient is created with the appropriate options and additional parameter has been added to getMockFromWsdl and passed through to the MockObject_Generator. This is required if your create a mock method for __doRequest and pass a complex xml string. If you do not have the option to set client options it can result in different interpretation of objects and arrays by the SOAPClient.


commentEnd

commit 6feebf90b00e8b3bd8714c0255890d22740e2ea0
File count: 1

Merge: 6f3aedc e825b20

    Merge branch '3.7'

commentEnd
commit e825b20cefa126cb26aa9a90b2153afbcd21f231
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit e825b20cefa126cb26aa9a90b2153afbcd21f231
commentStart

    Fixed an issue related to composer installs requiring `PHPUnit/Autoload.php`.
    
    If a composer project required `PHPUnit/Autoload.php` outside of a `vendor/bin/composer` run, you would get errors similar to #848.
    
    The PHPUnit_Mock_Objects project, for example, was untestable with a composer-based install as it included .phpt files which require `PHPUnit/Autoload.php`.
    
    This change also makes the `PHPUnit/Autoload.php` more consistent with `composer/bin/phpunit`.


commentEnd

commentStart

    Earlier declaration of $time in Util/PHP.php.

commit eed1616d3b4ed4ca9fbaf7ea445a2e85add97d42
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit eed1616d3b4ed4ca9fbaf7ea445a2e85add97d42
commentStart

    Travis integration
    
    - The include path is changed so we can make sure we don't use the system installed phpunit files by accident. Hopefully process isolation doesn't break this
    - The pear-core dependency is for PEAR_RunTest that can't be pulled in with composer as it's not a pear package but pear core
    - pear console-getopt is a dep of pear-core
    - --prefer-source is used to avoid issues with github api limits when downloading the zips.
    - The one skipped test doesn't work on travis and I'm not sure why and I'm aware this is not the nicest way to skip it but using $_ENV doesn't work due to the way the .phpt tests are executed


commentEnd

File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit 27e7ad1be6f6707f08f23668b67c4d6a1c2fe946
commentStart

    It's `phpunit-skelgen`, not `phpunit-skel`
    
    There is no `phpunit-skel` command, it is called `phpunit-skelgen`. I just installed from PEAR and here is a copy of my command-line output:
    
    phpunit-skelgen --help
    PHPUnit Skeleton Generator 1.1.0 by Sebastian Bergmann.
    
    Usage: phpunit-skelgen --class ClassTest
    ...


commentEnd

commit 0acdf520a49578aa299981edb29c31f1bdef6bea
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit 0acdf520a49578aa299981edb29c31f1bdef6bea
commentStart

    Handle reflected param names for variable length arguments
    
    The existing code handled cases where a PHP extension declared an argument for the reflection API without providing a name (typically done for referenced arguments). Also handle the case where the name it provides is "..." (i.e. variable arguments), as that would break mock object generation.
    
    See: http://php.net/manual/en/language.pseudo-types.php


commentEnd

commit d4efc6bd352d7e8e5e1bcfbab5a494f9317a3c51
File count: 3
---------------------------------------------
commit d4efc6bd352d7e8e5e1bcfbab5a494f9317a3c51

    Merge pull request #594 from austinhyde/listener-arguments-fix

commentEnd
commit dd560a3c18ee5072507a6c3a982e53eeba8bd5b5
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit dd560a3c18ee5072507a6c3a982e53eeba8bd5b5
commentStart

    Fixed the way PHPUnit_Util_Configuration parses listener constructor arguments
    
    Previously, getListenerConfiguration assumed the <arguments> element
    would always be the second element (index 1) because nicely formatted
    XML has a DOMText node containing a newline and some space before the
    arguments node. Computer-generated XML places the arguments element
    immediately after the listener element, so the node would be at index 0,
    causing the arguments node to not be found. Instead, it now searches
    the entire listener node for argument nodes.


commentEnd

commit 67876c2392cf2463423b8f57d60caf6145587a2a
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit 67876c2392cf2463423b8f57d60caf6145587a2a
commentStart

    Quick hack to make ResultPrinter.php include excluded tests in its output.
    
    I choose to use an underscore as the output as we would want to have the total percentage complete to end up with 100%. If instead we would call writeProgress(NULL) and not have it output anything nor increment $this->column, it would cause the total summary to continue to increment. That does have the side effect where if you hit a chunk of excluded tests, your counter may go from 122/1300 to 553/1300 on the following line with no real indication of why.
    
    Another option I thought of was to instead cause the total number of tests counter to decrement, but that also looks weird if you go from 120/1500 (8%) to 160/800 (20%). But in the case when you exclude large chunks, it would prevent lots of useless output.


commentEnd
commit 69979b6d72106ec9bdf821b9dab18446bb04f0d9

commit cb05fe5fb859c76f0926dedbe891f6702638c1cd
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit cb05fe5fb859c76f0926dedbe891f6702638c1cd
commentStart

    Fixes #443: JSON Log now properly includes the output after it was removed in 3.6.
    
    I've used this way of implementing it to keep BC issues to a minimum.
    Only the output is now properly json encoded and kept with the test
    instead of being output afterwards inbetween the json strings as this
    could be an issue while parsing.


commentEnd

commit 01b6af343a6b421a58272806c756ecb8d01b94f0
File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit 01b6af343a6b421a58272806c756ecb8d01b94f0
commentStart

    Use var_export() instead of addcslashes() on serialized/generated data for process isolation - addcslashes() screws up null byte escape sequences, which causes PHP to crash with garbage output - thou shalt not mutate thy serialize() output.


commentEnd

commit e7d0ab7bb8958959bf1e53dd7d2a20b57954a224
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit e7d0ab7bb8958959bf1e53dd7d2a20b57954a224
commentStart

        Fixing a class name detection problem similar to
        https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/71
    
        When running "phpunit AllTests.php" on a Horde test suite file PHPUnit
        identifies the class we extend from as our test suite class.
    
        The patch uses reflection to ensure the detected class is actually
        defined in the file that has been loaded.


commentEnd

commit d38ea8fbc8792391771efd8e03e8c39b9266cfbb
File count: 55
---------------------------------------------
commit d38ea8fbc8792391771efd8e03e8c39b9266cfbb
commentStart

    Replaced PHPUnit_Framework_Constraint_IsEqual::recursiveComparison() with a comparator sub-component
    
    This sub-component has three final goals:
    
     * Allow end-users to override the comparison mechanism for specific
       data types. This is especially interesting when classes have internal,
       random property values (for example generated tokens or IDs) that
       should be ignored when comparing two objects.
    
       This goal is achieved by this commit. You can implement a custom
       extension of PHPUnit_Framework_Comparator and register it by passing
       it to PHPUnit_Framework_Comparator::register(). Look at the source of
       the existing comparators for more inspiration.
    
     * Currently, PHPUnit fails to print the difference between very large
       object trees. These trees are converted to strings using print_r(),
       which fails to export such large trees and leads to segmentation
       faults. You can reproduce this behaviour by passing two unequal
       Doctrine_Record[1] instances to assertEquals().
    
       This goal will be achieved in a future commit.
    
     * Currently, the diff output for large object trees is very hard to use,
       because the diff contains much more information than necessary to
       inspect the error. Because comparators throw
       PHPUnit_Framework_ComparisonFailure instances when they fail, they can
       also provide a lot of information about where exactly the comparison
       failed.
    
       This goal will also be achieved in a future commit.
    
    [1] http://www.doctrine-project.org


commentEnd
commit 5937d9a101ed573290cbdc68a9d331e644cb75cc
File count: 19
---------------------------------------------

commit 1723583a1e1817f60fde44c1f306f167edc43c8a
File count: 0
---------------------------------------------
commit 1723583a1e1817f60fde44c1f306f167edc43c8a
commentStart

    Correcting the logic of how --stop-on-error and --stop-on-failure interrupt the tests' execution
    
    According to the docs:
    --stop-on-error          Stop execution upon first error.
    --stop-on-failure        Stop execution upon first error or failure.
    
    However, currently, if an error occurs, and --stop-on-failure is specified, the execution isn't interrupted. The patch is fixing that.


commentEnd

commentStart

    Update Selenium Driver for regexpi: match pattern
    
    For matching string values, Selenium supports four pattern syntaxes,
    glob, regexp, regexpi, and exact. This change adds support for regexpi,
    a case insensitive regular-expression.


commentEnd

commit 9b17d00019f02c72cab1e56a2f27caab063ad873

commentEnd
commit 17cf7df1389af9f161188a25f2f274b7e7befe62
File count: 1
---------------------------------------------
commit 17cf7df1389af9f161188a25f2f274b7e7befe62
commentStart

    Fix queries in PostgreSQL Metadata and make schema optional in all drivers.
    
    The metadata queries for PostgreSQL were incorrect. They were using
    the schema parameter as the table name (catalog in pgsql) which caused
    the queries to fail to produce any work. Furthermore the schema was
    hardcoded to 'public' negating the effect of the schema parameter.
    
    In addition to fixing the queries I made the schema parameter to a
    database connection optional. It now defaults to an empty string.
    In MySQL, SQlite, and Oracle this parameter is not used. PostgreSQL
    is likely the only RDBMS to use it. In the PostgreSQL metadata class
    if the schema is empty the default 'public' one is used. This is
    consistent with the database engine itself where tables created without
    a schema default to public.


commentEnd
commit a5f888efd7a51fc5269e49eaea815ee8618a1cba
File count: 6
---------------------------------------------
commit a5f888efd7a51fc5269e49eaea815ee8618a1cba
commentStart

    Remove PHPUnit_Extensions_SeleniumTestCase::$autoStop.


commentEnd

commentStart

    Fix PHPT test suite
    
    PHPT tests are skipped if the word "skip" is found in the output.
    Currently, no tests are skipped as the SKIPIF section never display "skip".
    
    The fix is to switch from die() to echo (optional but there is no need to die)
    and to prefix all messages with "skip"


commentEnd

commit 36739f10da817cc43da300d013eb38b357756557

commentEnd
commit 6cee0a78fb5c7dd10ee333e97509d46e33c5ed5a
File count: 2
---------------------------------------------
commit 6cee0a78fb5c7dd10ee333e97509d46e33c5ed5a
commentStart

    Change the XML configuration paths to be converted to absolute paths based on the directory of the XML file instead of the current working directory.
    
    It makes the configuration paths more predictable.
    
    Before the patch, you were forced to run the phpunit command from the same directory as the XML configuration file.
    For instance, to run the PHPUnit tests, you must use the following:
    
      cd PHPUnit/Tests/
      phpunit --configuration=configuration.xml
    
    After the patch, the above still works, but you can also run the tests from the main PHPUnit directory:
    
      cd ../..
      phpunit --configuration=PHPUnit/Tests/configuration.xml
    
    The patch also changes the paths contained in the current test suite of PHPUnit, as it assumes that PHPUnit is run from the XML file directory.


commentEnd
commit 8a9d4d42ad567f71b5b5ae6168fd0c58c0a90a70

---------------------------------------------
commit 8a9d4d42ad567f71b5b5ae6168fd0c58c0a90a70

File count: 11
---------------------------------------------
commit 28e5116ffee2a4e755f3be1312a4ed5e6492398d
commentStart

    Add support for global configuration of backup/restore operations for
      global variables and static attributes in user-defined classes, both
      via TextUI switches and XML configuration file directives.
    Add support for @backupGlobals and @backupStaticAttributes annotations
      to control the backup/restore operations for global variables and
      static attributes in user-defined classes, both on the test class
      level and the test method level.


commentEnd

---------------------------------------------
commit 3fc0a1c3784255a69d6f09a980a0da1f6af78b27
commentStart

    Resurrect the support for mocking static methods.
      Please note that calls from unmocked methods are only forwarded to
      mocked methods if the unmocked method uses static::mockedMethod()
      instead of self::mockedMethod() (or MockedClass::mockedMethod()).


commentEnd

    Remove deprecated functionality: --log-graphviz, --log-metrics, --log-pmd.
    Require PHP 5.3.0 (or later) and remove compatibility workarounds for older
      versions of PHP.
    Rename PHPUnit_Util_Class::getClassesInFile() and
      PHPUnit_Util_Class::getFunctionsInFile() to
      PHPUnit_Util_File::getClassesInFile() and
      PHPUnit_Util_File::getFunctionsInFile(), respectively.


commentEnd

File count: 7
---------------------------------------------
commit 1492da2368bc4020a79225db99e5413b3a22da10
commentStart

    PHPUnit_Extensions_SeleniumTestCase
      - Use cookies to "communicate" with server-side code coverage collection.
    
    PHPUnit_Util_Log_PDO
      - Create test node in startTest() and store the test's result later.
      - Add getCurrentTestId() and getRunId().
      - Add Singleton implementation that only optionally creates the object.
    
    PHPUnit_TextUI_TestRunner
      - Update to use PHPUnit_Util_Log_PDO::getInstance().


commentEnd

commit 1254918530e879f635c55b90a540f0ee3005660b
File count: 6
---------------------------------------------
commit 1254918530e879f635c55b90a540f0ee3005660b
commentStart

    Do not force xdebug.collect_vars=1 because it slows down the execution.
      If your tests rely on variables that are set in the global scope of
      your test case's source (see http://pear.php.net/bugs/bug.php?id=5053)
      you need to set this in your php.ini configuration file.


commentEnd
